intro: Hieracium cuneifrons, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium cuneifrons is often found in temperate climates and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
